recipes.label: Docking to London
recipes.startdescription: Up the Thames, until the river is more brown than grey, and the air more noise than silence. Here we dock.

recipes.label: Docking to Amsterdam
recipes.startdescription: The Kite sails waterways sharp as a knife's cut. No people have tamed water as the Dutch have. No people should fear its escape as much. I dock in IJ-Haven, with the same prayer on my lips as all the rest.

recipes.label: Docking to Copenhagen
recipes.startdescription: The sea might be unpredictable, but the District of Nyhavn is bright and inviting. The Kite comes to rest at the dock as for a comfortable hibernation.
